intro: Uragoga afzelii, commonly known as the African velvetleaf, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, pale yellow flowers. The plant is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and agricultural fields. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, and it has a fibrous root system that allows it to thrive in poor soil conditions. Uragoga afzelii is also noted for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
